info.title: SendSafely REST API
info.description:
Documented endpoints for the SendSafely REST API. To call the endpoints a SendSafely API Key and Secret is required to calculate the request signature.

This document is a draft, and should be considered a work in progress.

tags.name: package
tags.description: Create package, upload encrypted data, add recipients, and finalize

tags.name: contact group
tags.description: Create/delete contact group, add/delete contact group user

tags.name: dropzone management
tags.description: add/get/delete dropzone recipients and update dropzone configurations

parameters.name: packageId
parameters.description: Unique package identifier, which can be the packageId or packageCode values

post.description:
Finalize the package

Note that the message property of the response contains the secure link for accessing the encrypted message. When sharing the link with a recipient, the client-side generated secret should be passed as the value of a keyCode parameter appended as a URL Fragment Identifier. For example:

https://companyabc.sendsafely.com:8443/receive/?thread=JRPE-XSR2&packageCode=EsUUhFULgu2H0X0hU8uDHzCBp02k4X62tTic2V1MsBY#keyCode=XXXXYYYYY

put.description:
Upload encrypted message.

To encrypt the message, you will need to use an encryption library that implements the OpenPGP message format. Specifically, the following is required when encrypting with OpenPGP:

  • The Symmetric-Key Algorithm should be 9 (AES-256)
  • The Compression Algorithm should be 0 (Uncompressed)
  • The Hash Algorithm should be 8 (SHA-256)

The 256-bit encryption key is the package server secret concatenated with a random 256-bit secret generated client-side, which will be included as the "keyCode" parameter in the secure link.

put.summary: Creates a new file within a package
put.description: Creates a new file within a package. The unique fileId is returned as a result.

post.description: Gets the file part upload URLs for the file. Up to 25 urls are returned at once.

post.summary: Sets the file upload status as complete
post.description: Sets the file upload status as complete. The server will verify that all segments are present within S3.

get.summary: Get package keycode by public key id

put.summary: Add Keycode by public key id

parameters.name: directoryIndex
parameters.description: The index for paging subdirectories within the current directory

parameters.name: fileIndex
parameters.description: The index for paging files within the current directory

post.description: Gets the file part S3 download URLs for a file. Up to 25 urls are returned at once.

post.summary: Get Download URLs for file in directory
post.description: Gets the file part S3 download URLs for file in a directory. Up to 25 urls are returned at once.

Returns packages in the current user's organization based on provided search criteria. The search defaults to returning all packages up to the current date and time, if a specific value is not passed for each search criteria. A maximum of 100 records will be returned per method call. The calling user must be a SendSafely Enterprise Administrator.

post.summary: Copies a file from a SendSafely Package to a SendSafely Workspace

put.summary: Add Contact Group to Package as Recipients
put.description: Add Contact Group to Package as Recipients

get.summary: Sync keycodes by public key id
get.description: Sync keycodes by public key id

pageParam.name: pageSize
pageParam.description: Number of rows to return, maximum of 100

status.example: all | picked-up | incomplete | archived | active | expired
status.description: all | picked-up | incomplete | archived | active | expired

part.description: The file part number you would like as the starting point for this group of URLs. No more than 25 file parts are returned at once.

message.example: -----BEGIN PGP PUBLIC KEY BLOCK----- -----END PGP PUBLIC KEY BLOCK-----

undisclosedRecipients.description: Optional, default is false, set to true if package has no recipients

vdr.description: Optional parameter that should only be set to true if creating a Workspace package

key.example: -----BEGIN PGP PUBLIC KEY BLOCK----- -----END PGP PUBLIC KEY BLOCK-----
-----BEGIN PGP PUBLIC KEY BLOCK----- -----END PGP PUBLIC KEY BLOCK-----

success.example: Your list has been updated. It may take up to 30 minutes for all active items to be updated.

dropzoneNotificationType.description: 0 for Do not notify recipients, 1 for notify via email with trusted browser, 2 for notify via email with untrusted browser

dropzoneRequireAuthentication.description: true to request users to verify email address

dropzoneRestrictDownload.description: true to restrict download and allow preview of pdf and images only

checksum.description: HmacSHA256(keycode,packageCode) - Can only be set on a Workspace and by users with the Owner or Manager role.

startSegment.description: The file part number you would like as the starting point for this group of URLs. No more than 25 file parts are returned at once.

endSegment.description: The file part number you would like as the ending point for this group of URLs. No more than 25 file parts are returned at once.

packageState.description: This provides the numeric representation of package state. What follows is a mapping of packageState and the corresponding packageStateStr value: 1 Expired - Not Picked Up | 2 Expired - Pickup | 3 Active - Pickup Complete | 4 Active - Waiting for Pickup | 5 Active - Pickup In Progress |  6 Complete Expired - Pickup In Progress | 0 - In Progess | -1 Deleted - Pickup Complete | -2 TEMP | -3 Deleted - Not Picked Up | -4 Deleted - Pickup In Progress

packageStateStr.description: String representation of the packageState property. What follows is a listing of possible packageStateStr values: Expired - Not Picked Up | Expired - Pickup | Active - Pickup Complete | Active - Waiting for Pickup | Active - Pickup In Progress | Complete Expired - Pickup In Progress | In Progess | Deleted - Pickup Complete | TEMP | Deleted - Not Picked Up | Deleted - Pickup In Progress
